Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target

Interface ISyncLicenseTerm

All Superinterfaces:
ISyncDataType
public interface ISyncLicenseTerm extends ISyncDataType
Defines a license term composing restrictions and allowances.

Overview

License terms cluster various license attributes into a single instance. Assets may refer to this instance instead of having to replicate all license term attributes to their own property space.

License terms receives a translated name for UI and a sequence number. The sequence number is some sort of ID. Nevertheless it is not globally unique but only within the same tenant.

License terms are never changed but somewhat read-only. When purchasing an asset a snapshot of the current active license is attached to it. The purchase is based on this license term. Hence it must not be changed afterwards. In case new license terms become active, the previous one is marked as inactive and a new license term instance is created.

These license terms need to be stored with the sync target. There is no need to read these values, as they are NOT compared to the values at Smint.io. Smint.io platform is the master source of these values and thus during synchronization these value are only being set and not retrieved.

Storing license terms with target DAM

License terms contain quite a list of restrictions and allowances of usage terms. It is possible to map all those attributes into asset space or copy the same term attributes to all assets they apply to. Nevertheless it would be best to store these data as a separate metadata instance and just refer to it with the asset. Unfortunately, not all target DAM support such an operation. In that case, it is acceptable to copy all license attributes to each asset. Keep in mind to store the sequence number and the translated license term name with each asset, too.

Creation of new instances

Every instance is being created with ISyncTargetDataFactory.createSyncLicenseTerm().

  • Method Details

    • setSequenceNumber

      ISyncLicenseTerm setSequenceNumber(int sequenceNumber)
      Sets the sequence number of this license term, which is unique only for the current tenant.

      License terms use a Smint.io sequence number to be unique for a single tenant. License that become invalid (see setValidUntil(OffsetDateTime)) are not deleted but kept for archiving reasons. New license terms are created with a next available sequence number. There is no ID for license terms which is unique with Smint.io platform.

      A sequence number is a positive value. All values below 0 are considered invalid and must not be stored to the sync target. Such values may be set for temporary use.

      Parameters:
      sequenceNumber - the new sequence number or equal to below 0.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setName

      ISyncLicenseTerm setName(Map<Locale,String> name)
      Sets a localized name for this license term.
      Parameters:
      name - the new localized name or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setExclusivities

      ISyncLicenseTerm setExclusivities(String[] exclusivityKeys)
      Sets a list of exclusive rights that are granted and on that the restrictions in this instance applies to.

      Each value is a sync target platform specific ID, mapped from Smint.io key.

      Parameters:
      exclusivityKeys - the sync target ID of exclusivity granted or null.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setValidFrom

      ISyncLicenseTerm setValidFrom(OffsetDateTime validFrom)
      Sets the date when making use of the related asset can be started.
      Parameters:
      validFrom - the date this asset is allowed to be used after or null if no restriction apply.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setValidUntil

      ISyncLicenseTerm setValidUntil(OffsetDateTime validUntil)
      Sets the date until making use of the related asset must be stopped.
      Parameters:
      validUntil - the date before this asset is allowed to be used but not after. null if no restrictions apply.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setToBeUsedUntil

      ISyncLicenseTerm setToBeUsedUntil(OffsetDateTime toBeUsedUntil)
      Sets the date until making use of the related asset for the first time must be started.

      Some content providers prohibit sharding, meaning buying a lot of exclusive content but not making use of it. This behavior would block others from exclusive content without effectively making use of the content itself. Blocking other is the main achievement. So a licensor might require the licensee to make use of the asset before a specific date.

      Parameters:
      toBeUsedUntil - the date before this asset must be used for the first time. null if no restrictions apply.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface

    • setIsEditorialUse

      ISyncLicenseTerm setIsEditorialUse(Boolean isEditorialUse)
      Sets a flag that this term restricts the use of the related asset to editorial usage.

      Until a value has been passed to this function, it can not be determined whether the asset is for editorial use only or not. There might be some content provider that do not provide this information on some assets. It simply is impossible to tell. The default assumption and its derived legal action depends on the synchronization target. Smint.io can not give any advise how to handle such content.

      Parameters:
      isEditorialUse - Boolean.TRUE in case the term restricts for Editorial Use only and Boolean.FALSE otherwise. If this can not be determined, than null is being set.
      Returns:
      this to support Fluent Interface
